page.title: 02YANWORTH AND THE I981 CENSUS
page.content: The {census figures}for the{civil {parish of Yanworth}included the estate buildings etc. at Stowell Park. With this small exception, the census area very conveniently also corresponds with this study area. Again very conveniently _ with the same exception _ {the study area}to a very large extent {corresponds with {the boundaries of one of the largest {privately owned and run agricultural {estates in the county, (c.5040 acres). The census figures reflected some aspects of living in rural Yanworth. For example, of the 45 households only about two were owner occupied and none were rented from the council. With a negligible number of privately rented properties {almost all the population {live in tied agricultural cottages.The {result has been an unspoilt landscape {with a farming orientated population.
